item.title: taking pictures, stalking | 6th November 2024
item.dc:creator: no#15
item.description: Summery: On November 6th, 2024, between 01:35PM and 01:00AM the next day, multiple suspicious activities involving the resident of no#14...
item.content:encoded:
Summery:

On November 6th, 2024, between 01:35PM and 01:00AM the next day, multiple suspicious activities involving the resident of no#14 were observed:
* At 01:35: no#14 appeared to be recording/photographing us as we left for shopping.
* Shortly after: no#14 was outside, walking towards our bins, then our front door.
* At 14:00: no#14 walked past tour window, observing it and the camera.
* At 20:00: Similar behaviour was noted, with only snapshots captured.
* At 01:00 (Nov 7th): no#14 walked his dog in front of our door, but no footage was recorded due to low light.

The incident has been reported to the police via 101 as advised by WDH Sam Palmer.

Reported To:
Logged on this CMS | WDH  | The Police via 101

Details:
On November 6th, 2024, at approximately 01:35, we left to go shopping, we noticed the resident of no#14 standing at his window.
The individual appeared to be holding a phone in a manner suggesting he was recording or photographing us. Upon noticing that he had been seen, the resident of no#14 quickly ducked out of view.
Approximately two minutes after we had left, the resident of #14 was observed walking outside our flat.
He briefly returned before re-emerging, at which point he walked towards our bins aswell as fixating on our front door.
Further observations were made throughout the day:
*At 14:00, the resident of #14 was seen walking past the front room window of our flat, looking at both the windows and our camera.
*A similar observation was made at 20:00 as the resident was leaving his property. Only snapshots of this event were captured by the camera.
*At approximately 01:00 on the 7th, the resident of no#14 returned and took his dog out in front of our door camera. Due to low light conditions, the motion detector did not activate, and no footage was recorded.
*Action Taken:
As advised by WDH Sam Palmer, this incident has been reported to the police for further investigation and documentation.

Video:

item.title: Apprehension of Resident at no#14 | 13th October 2024
item.dc:creator: no#15
item.description: Summery: on October 13, 2024, at approximately 6:13 PM, law enforcement officers made another attempt to apprehend the resident of...
item.content:encoded:
Summery: on October 13, 2024, at approximately 6:13 PM, law enforcement officers made another attempt to apprehend the resident of 14 Pine Close. Unlike previous attempts, this time they were successful. This action followed numerous unsuccessful requests for the individual to attend a voluntary appearance (VA).The resident has a documented history of non-compliance with both law enforcement and housing authorities (WDH). Summery and Details
—-On October 13, 2024, at approximately 6:13 PM, law enforcement officers made
—-another attempt to apprehend the resident of 14 Pine Close. Unlike previous
—-attempts, this time they were successful. This action followed numerous
—-unsuccessful requests for the individual to attend a voluntary appearance (VA).
—-The resident has a documented history of non-compliance with both law
—-enforcement and housing authorities (WDH).
1. Initial Observation and Notification
◦    6:02 PM (00:01 in video): The resident of no#14 was seen returning to his flat.
—-We contacted the police via 101 as previously instructed.
◦    6:14 PM (00:14): An officer knocked on our door to confirm the resident of no#14’s
—-presence. Lucy confirmed his presence, to which the officer thanked her and
—-walked away.
2. Police Arrival and Initial Attempts
◦    6:16 PM (01:24): A second officer arrived to assist in apprehending the resident.
◦    6:17 PM (01:52): An officer was seen looking up at the resident’s windows for
—-visual confirmation.
◦    6:17 PM (02:00): Officers knocked on no#14’s door.
◦    6:17 PM (02:09): Another officer was seen walking around the side of the flats.
3. Escalation of Efforts
◦    6:17 PM – 6:19 PM (02:23): Officers walked back and forth in front of the flats
—-trying to spot the resident at his windows.
◦    6:19 PM (02:46): A bang noise, presumably made by an officer, triggered the
—-resident to shout, “The fuck they doing.” Some inaudible talking followed but
—-could not be clearly recorded.
◦    6:19 PM (03:13): An officer was seen walking the perimeter of the flats.
◦    6:19 PM (03:21): Officers knocked on the door again, triggering dog barks
—-from inside.
◦    6:20 PM (03:47): An officer was seen at the front while running sounds were
—-audible from above.
4. Resident’s Evasive Behaviour
◦    6:20 PM (04:18): Running sounds were heard from inside 14 Pine Close, indicating
—-activity.
◦    6:21 PM (04:39): An officer walked down the side of the flats; shortly after, sounds
—-of items falling over were heard from above.
◦    6:21 PM (05:08): Another police car arrived to assist with apprehending the
—-resident. Officers were seen accessing their vehicle’s boot while discussing the
—-situation.
5. Conversation at our door
◦    6:26 PM – 6:27 PM (08:06 – 08:46): An officer explained they knew the resident
—-was home because they had seen him at the window.
—-They warned Lucy about a potential loud bang if they needed to force entry.
—-Lucy informed them about a dangerous dog that had previously attempted to
—-snatch an officer’s button through the letterbox.
6. Final Apprehension
◦    6:28 PM – 6:32 PM (09:29 – 12:28): Officers continued to stand outside as it got
—-darker. Another police car arrived at this time.
◦    6:29 PM (10:42): A large officer was seen shouting at the window.
◦    6:30 PM (11:00): An officer could be heard saying “Come Down.”
—-(Repeated x3 and x3 slower in video)
◦    6:32 PM (12:28): The larger officer awaited a response while sounds from above
—-indicated movement.
7. Conclusion of Incident
◦    6:36 PM (13:13): The sound of 14 Pine Close’s door closing was heard as a police
—-car approached.
◦    6:36 PM (13:50): Officers escorted the resident into a police vehicle.
◦    At approximately 15 minutes and 20 seconds in video, police cars were seen
—-driving away with the resident inside.

Video:

item.title: Evading Police continues into Third Day | 11th October2024
item.dc:creator: no#15
item.description: Summery: On October 11, 2024, at approximately 11:48 AM, law enforcement officers made another attempt to apprehend the resident of...
item.content:encoded:
Summery: On October 11, 2024, at approximately 11:48 AM, law enforcement officers made another attempt to apprehend the resident of 14 Pine Close. This action followed numerous unsuccessful requests for the individual to attend a voluntary appearance (VA). The resident has a documented history of non-compliance with both law enforcement and housing authorities (WDH).Summery and Details
—-On October 11, 2024, at approximately 11:48 AM, law enforcement officers
—-made another attempt to apprehend the resident of 14 Pine Close.
—-This action followed numerous unsuccessful requests for the individual to
—-attend a voluntary appearance (VA). The resident has a documented history
—-of non-compliance with both law enforcement and housing authorities (WDH).
 1.  11:48 AM
—-Officers arrived at the location, as evidenced by photographic documentation.
 2.  11:50 AM
 —-At 11:50 AM (00:20 into the attached video), officers knocked loudly on the
—-door of 14 Pine Close. The resident ignored this attempt, despite being
—-audible inside the property shortly before and after the knocking.
 3.  Subsequent Attempts
◦    At 11:50 AM (00:42 in video), officers knocked again, followed by additional
—-knocks at 11:51 AM (01:10 and 01:44 in video).
◦    Shortly after, Lucy answered the door at 11:52 AM (02:55 in video) and spoke
—-with an officer for around 40 seconds before closing the door at 11:53 AM.
 4.  Continued Ignoring
◦    At 11:54 AM (04:08 in video), officers knocked on number 14 once more
—-but received no response.
◦    Between 11:55 AM and 11:56 AM (04:55 in video), officers were observed
—-walking around the area, looking up at the windows in an attempt to locate
—-the resident but were unsuccessful.
 5.  Further Attempts to Make Contact
◦    Officers knocked again at 11:58 AM (05:47 in video) and continued to be
—-ignored, with only an aggressive dog barking from within.
◦    Additional knocks occurred at 11:59 AM (06:10 in video) and again at 12:00 PM
—-(06:48 in video). A loud bang was heard from above during this time,
—-indicating the resident’s presence.
◦    Despite further attempts at knocking shortly thereafter
—-(12:00 PM, 07:02 in video), the officers were still ignored.
 6.  Revisiting Neighbor for Discussion
◦    At 12:02 PM (08:22 in video), officers returned to our door to discuss the
—-situation regarding number 14. During this time, they knocked again on
—-number 14 at 12:03 PM (08:46 in video) but received no response.
◦    Officers returned to speak with Lucy again at 12:03 PM (09:16 in video), where
—-they explained that due to the resident’s continued non-compliance and their
—-inability to confirm his presence, they could not enter the property.
—-They advised that we should call 101 when we are certain of his presence and
—-warn them about the aggressive dog that had previously attempted to
—-snatch an officer’s baton at the letterbox.
 7.  Conclusion of Visit
◦    The officers left at 12:05 PM (10:48 in video) and were seen driving away
—-at 12:06 PM (11:01 in video).
◦    Additional evidence includes a photo of their arrival at 11:48 AM
—-(11:22 in video) and a video from a living room window showing one officer
—-looking up at the flat windows of number 14 at 11:52 AM (11:33 in video),
—-which also displayed egg residue from prior incidents.

Video:

item.title: Evading Police again | 10th October2024
item.dc:creator: no#15
item.description: Summery: On October 10, 2024, at 10:38 AM, officers attempted to apprehend a resident at 14 Pine Close following multiple...
item.content:encoded:
Summery:
On October 10, 2024, at 10:38 AM, officers attempted to apprehend a resident at 14 Pine Close following multiple failed requests for a voluntary appearance
— The resident had a history of non-compliance with law enforcement
——– and housing authorities
—— ◉10:39 AM: Officers knocked forcefully on the door of number 14.
——– Despite audible activity inside, there was no response
—— ◉10:40 AM: Officers knocked on our door to inquire about the resident,
——– but we had left for shopping 20 minutes earlier
——◉ 10:42 AM: After receiving no response, the officers departed.
——– As they drove away, sounds of movement were captured from
——– the upper floor of number 14

Details:
On October 10, 2024, at approximately 10:38AM, officers arrived at 14 Pine Close to attempt apprehension of the resident. This action followed multiple unsuccessful requests for the individual to attend a voluntary appearance (VA). The resident has an established history of non-compliance with both law enforcement agencies and housing authorities (WDH).
1. 10:39 AM (01:14 in attached video): Officers knocked forcefully on the door of number 14. The resident appeared to be present but non-responsive, as evidenced by audible activity within the premises both before and after the officers’ attempt to make contact.
2. 10:40 AM (02:06 in attached video): Officers proceeded to knock on our door to inquire about the resident of number 14. However we had left for a shopping approximately 20 minutes prior.
3. 10:42 AM (04:03 and 05:21 in attached video, from different camera angles): After receiving no response, the officers departed the premises. As they drove away, the video captured sounds of movement from the upper floor of number 14.

Video:

item.title: Evading Police and Emerging After They Leave | 09th October2024
item.dc:creator: no#15
item.description: Summery: On October 09, 2024, police made two attempts to apprehend the resident of Flat #14 Pine Close due to...
item.content:encoded:
Summery:
On October 09, 2024, police made two attempts to apprehend the resident of Flat #14 Pine Close due to ongoing non-compliance with requests to attend a voluntary appearance (VA).
—1. First attempt 8:58 AM
——◉Police arrived and knocked on the resident’s door multiple times, as documented in the attached video.
——◉ Officers also spoke with Lucy about the tenant of flat no#14.
——◉ After nearly an hour of attempts, they left at approximately 9:51 AM without making contact.
—2. Second attempt 12:41 PM
——◉ Officers returned and again knocked on the door but received no response.
——◉ They consulted with Lucy once more before leaving at 12:47 PM.
—Subsequent behavior:
——◉ The resident has a history of ignoring both police and WDH requests.
——◉ Sounds were heard from within Flat #14 throughout the day,
——– indicating the resident’s presence.
——◉ The resident was observed leaving the flat 4 minutes after police departure.

Details:
On October 09, 2024, at approximately 8:57AM, officers arrived at Pine Close and made two separate attempts to apprehend the resident of Flat #14 Pine Close following numerous unsuccessful requests for the individual to attend a voluntary appearance (VA)
This was not their first attempt, this resident has a history of non-compliance with both law enforcement and housing authorities (WDH)
First Attempt – 8:58 AM
Officers arrived at the premises at 8:58 AM, as documented in the attached video at 6:52. They repeatedly knocked on the door of Flat #14, audible in the recording at 00:32 and several times thereafter.
• At 01:06, officers knocked on our door.
• At 01:45, officers spoke with Lucy, regarding the tenant of Flat #14.
• Multiple attempts were made to contact the resident of Flat #14.
• At 09:26 in the video (corresponding to 4:53 AM real-time), officers departed after nearly an hour of attempted contact.
• sounds of banging and movement were audible from within Flat #14, indicating the resident’s presence.
Second Attempt – 12:41 PM
Law enforcement returned to the location at 12:41 PM, as seen in the video at 09:36. During this attempt:
• At 10:22 in the video, officers knocked on the door of Flat #14 but received no response.
• At 12:05 in the video, officers again consulted with Lucy regarding the resident of Flat #14.
• After further unsuccessful attempts to make contact, the police left the premises at 12:47 PM, visible in the video at 15:47.
• At 03:51PM (real-time), approximately four minutes after police departure, the resident was observed leaving the flat. This is visible in the attached video at 16:57.

Video:

item.title: Evading Police Presence Then Walking Outside Shortly After Their Departure | 28th September 2024
item.dc:creator: no#15
item.description: Summery: On September 28, 2024, police made two attempts to conduct a Vulnerability Assessment for the resident of flat #14...
item.content:encoded:
Summery:
On September 28, 2024, police made two attempts to conduct a Vulnerability Assessment for the resident of flat #14 at Pine Close:
—1. First attempt 11:05 AM
——◉ Officers arrived at 11:05 AM
——◉ Officers left at 11:09 AM
——◉ Resident briefly exited with dog, then quickly returned upon seeing police
—2.Second attempt 3:49 PM:
——◉ Officers arrived at 3:49 AM
——◉ Resident seen in window but ignored officers
——◉ Police left at 3:52 PM
Subsequent behavior:
–—◉ Resident remained in flat for 6 hours with intermittent noise disturbances
—–◉ From 9:30 PM onwards, resident observed:
——◉ Walking around outside repeatedly
——◉ Looking through our window as passing at 10:32 PM
——◉ Briefly returning to flat, then continuing to walk around outside

Details:
On September 28, 2024, at approximately 11:05 AM, officers arrived at Pine Close in an attempt to conduct a Vulnerability Assessment (VA) for the resident of flat no#14. This was not their first attempt, as the resident has a history of ignoring both the police and WDH.
The officers departed at precisely 11:09 AM. Less than one minute later, the resident was observed exiting his flat with his dog.
Upon noticing a police vehicle driving down a street out of camera view, he was seen hastily returning to his flat, pulling the dog along.
At 3:49 PM, nearly five hours after the initial attempt, the police returned to make another effort to communicate with the resident of flat no#14.
This time, they waited longer than before and the officers became aware that the resident was present and deliberately ignoring them, as he was spotted in the window and overheard shouting at his dog for barking.
At 3:52 PM, after being ignored once again, the police left the premises.
Subsequently, the resident remained inside the apartment for approximately six hours, during which time intermittent stomping, banging, and shouting were heard.
from 9:30 PM, the resident of flat no#14 was observed walking around outside our flat on multiple occasions over several hours.
At 10:32 PM, he can be seen looking through our window while passing our flat.
Following this, he returned to his apartment briefly, where stomping noises were heard for a couple of minutes. He then came back outside and continued to walk around.

Video:
